snippet: A 7-inch tablet that carries the Google brand might finally become a reality in a few months. But will it have better luck than the ill-fated Google phone?
abstract: A 7-inch tablet that carries the Google brand might finally become a reality in a few months. But will it have better luck than the ill-fated Google phone?

headline.main: With Tablet Plan, Google Goes After Apple and Amazon

byline.original: By DAVID STREITFELD and NICK BILTON

snippet: Responding to a critical investigation of its factories, Foxconn, a top electronics supplier for Apple and other companies, pledged to curtail working hours and increase wages.

headline.main: Electronic Giant Vowing Reforms in China Plants
headline.print_headline: Electronic Giant Vowing Reforms In China Plants

byline.original: By CHARLES DUHIGG and STEVEN GREENHOUSE

snippet: Foxconn, which manufactures electronics for such companies as Apple, Dell, Amazon and others, has pledged to sharply curtail the number of working hours within its Chinese factories and significantly increase wages.
abstract: Foxconn, which manufactures electronics for such companies as Apple, Dell, Amazon and others, has pledged to sharply curtail the number of working hours within its Chinese factories and significantly increase wages.

headline.main: Apple Supplier in China Pledges Big Labor Changes

snippet: The Fair Labor Association found widespread problems in labor practices at Foxconn, the electronics giant that supplies Apple and other companies.

byline.original: Nadia Sussman and Mac William Bishop

snippet: AT&T says its push for the new Nokia Lumia 900 smartphone, set for release April 8, will be its biggest product introduction ever - surpassing even the iPhone.
abstract: AT&T says its push for the new Nokia Lumia 900 smartphone, set for release April 8, will be its biggest product introduction ever - surpassing even the iPhone.

headline.main: AT&T Plans Marketing Deluge for Nokia Windows Phone
headline.print_headline: AT&T Sees A Challenger To the iPhone

snippet: Timothy D. Cook’s visit to a Foxconn plant comes as the company has been criticized for working conditions there.

headline.main: Apple’s Chief Visits iPhone Factory in China
headline.print_headline: Apple’s Chief Visits iPhone Factory in China

snippet: Also, turning Hollywood into New York and The New Republic drops its paywall.
abstract: Also, turning Hollywood into New York and The New Republic drops its paywall.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: News Corp. in the News, and Apple's Chief in China

snippet: Ala, a Turkish publication, is an unlikely fusion of conservative Muslim values and high fashion, and has been called the “Vogue of the veiled.”
abstract: Istanbul Journal; Ala, a Turkish publication, is an unlikely fusion of conservative Muslim values and high fashion, and has been called the 'Vogue of the veiled;' it unabashedly appeals to the pious head-scarf-wearing working woman, who may covet a Louis Vuitton purse but has no use for the revealing clothing that pervades traditional fashion magazines.

headline.main: A Fashion Magazine Unshy About Baring a Bit of Piety
headline.print_headline: A Fashion Magazine Unshy About Baring A Bit of Piety

snippet: A group led by Magic Johnson agreed to buy the Dodgers for $2.15 billion, gambling that a new cable TV deal in 2013 will make the gigantic outlay worthwhile.
abstract: Analysis holds that in agreeing to buy the Los Angeles Dodgers for $2.15 billion, the group led by Magic Johnson is gambling that a new cable TV deal in 2013 will make the gigantic outlay worthwhile.

headline.main: A Team’s Huge Price Tag Is Tied to a TV Windfall
headline.print_headline: A Team’s Huge Price Tag Is Tied to a TV Windfall

snippet: The breakdown on the BATS Global Markets exchange was stunning, but market disruptions have been common enough to rattle some investors’ confidence. A review of industry data shows that disruptions large and small are a daily occurrence.
abstract: Breakdown on the BATS Global Markets exchange was stunning, but market disruptions have been common enough to rattle some investors’ confidence; review of industry data shows that disruptions large and small are a daily occurrence.

headline.main: Stock Market Flaws Not So Rare, Data Shows
headline.print_headline: BATS Flaw Not So Rare, Data Shows
